title: It’s an automatic response to cold. But why do we get goosebumps when scared, hearing a favorite song, or being around someone? - Quora

response.answer_text: I think getting goosebumps when scared has a similar purpose as cats do. We all still have some fur remaining on our skin, and goosebumps straighten them. Millions of years ago, we would have had more fur, and goosebumps would make our bodies look larger, which could scare away the thing that scaring you, increasing survivability. I guess this gene survived through natural selection.
